The 'black-footed cat' (Felis nigripes) is the smallest African cat, and is
endemic in the south west arid zone of the southern African subregion. It is one
of the lesser studied African carnivores, and is listed as Vulnerable by IUCN
since 2002. Database entry includes justification for why this
species is vulnerable Sliwa, A. (2004) Home range
size and social organization of black-footed cats (Felis nigripes). Mammalian
Biology 69 (2): 96-107
